attributes.action: Financial support &employment support/protection for women with endometriosis
attributes.background: 1 in 10 women suffer with endometriosis in the UK. Women are losing their jobs, having financial difficulties, being treated unfairly by employers and are not protected even though this is a long term chronic illness with no cure. We need protection and help please. Repeat surgeries and treatments.
attributes.additional_details:
Endometriosis falls under the NHS most 20 painful conditions https://www.nhs.uk/Livewell/Pain/Pages/20-painful-conditions.aspx 
 
This illness is serious, we are having surgeries every year some of us and more than once a year. However, we've no protection in work and it is not recognised by all employers as serious and we are not fully protected by the disability act or any act. 

Some women have been fired, we have no benefits available to us either if we are no longer able to work.

attributes.action: Bring carers allowance into line with jobseekers allowance.
attributes.background: People who are full time carers for loved ones can apply for carers allowance which the government recognise as working 35 hours per week caring for someone. Yet despite this carers get less money per week than people who are unemployed and are not eligible for any discounted travel.
attributes.additional_details:
People who are full time carers for loved ones can apply for carers allowance which the government recognise as working 35 hours per week caring for someone. Yet despite this carers allowance is set at £62.70 per week and are not eligible for any help in the form of discounted travel cards. However a person who is unemployed gets £73.10 and who has been for a period of 13 weeks gets a bus pass for duscounted travel. 
How is this fair??

attributes.action: Fairer road fund licence rates for motorcycles.
attributes.background: HMRC allows 24p per mile for business use on motorcycles yet allows 45p per mile for cars, it therefore seems unfair that motorcycles can pay considerably more in road fund licence than cars with similar emissions, they should be encouraged to be part of an integrated traffic solution not penalised.
attributes.additional_details: Motorcycles take up less space on our overcrowded roads, don't usually get held up in traffic and take up far less space when parked, as a result they will usually pollute less than most cars, yet motorcycles pay road fund licences based purely on engine size.  This means that modern, low emission machines can be paying £85 per year compared to zero for similarly poluting cars.  We therefore call on the government to reduce the road fund licences on all motorcycles.

attributes.action: Create a change to the law on home invasions, to further protect residents.
attributes.background: Currently the law only allows for ‘reasonable force’ in protecting ones home from an armed invader. This is too vague. With legitimate fear of injury or death, householders must be protected from prosecution or arrest if such a threat gives rise to an altercation in which a home invader dies.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2012 the Justice Secretary proposed amending the law in England and Wales on self-defence to protect householders who over-react when confronted by a burglar or intruder. 

We want the law to be shifted in favour of the householder to give them certainty that they will not be prosecuted, if a home invader dies during the course of an invasion, when armed with a weapon that can cause servere injury or death. 

We propose a ‘Castle Law’ that will protect victims from prosecution.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory training in autism for all NHS mental health services.
attributes.background:
1 in 68 people has an ASC. 
Over 50% of autistic people have depression. 
They are 28 times more likely to exhibit suicidal thoughts/behaviours. 
There is difficultly in accessing support, and staff are insufficiently trained. According to NAS, Transforming Care implementation needs improvement.
attributes.additional_details:
Because of the additional need for support, all mental health services are guaranteed to treat some autistic patients. However, many staff have no training in this whatsoever.   

Even basic training would have an immediate impact on helping autistic people engage with services effectively. 

Inpatient mental health care should be viewed as our last line of defence. Therefore it is imperative that these staff have, at minimum, a basic understanding of autism spectrum conditions.

attributes.action: 'Method of Slaughter' to be displayed on fresh/frozen meat and poultry.
attributes.background:
Currently UK law calls for all  fresh frozen meats & poultry to display country of rearing, slaughter, cutting and in some cases if the animal was under 6months old, but not the method of slaughter - 'stunned' or 'unstunned'.
As consumers we should have the right to make a conscientious choice.
attributes.additional_details:
The law states all animals should be stunned with the exception of religious slaughter; Halal and Kosher.
RSPCA's evidence clearly indicates that slaughter without pre-stunning can cause unnecessary suffering.
As consumers we should be able to make a conscientious choice whether to support unstunned slaughter or not, which is not possible without clear package labelling showing 'Method of slaughter'

attributes.action: Raise a Brain Aneurysm Awareness campaign
attributes.background: I recently lost my sister to a ruptured brain aneurysm. After numerous visits to doctors and hospitals for over a month. Not one of them even suspected this despite having all the symptoms of brain aneurysm.
attributes.additional_details:
One doctor suggested applying a hot water bottle to her head!!!
AWARENESS IS NEEDED.

attributes.action: Stop the Loan Charge 2019 from being applied retrospectively
attributes.background: The 2019 Loan Charge seeks to historically tax a significant proportion of UK freelance workers for employment arrangements they used over the last twenty years. This is estimated to affect around 100,000 workers across all sectors.
attributes.additional_details:
20 years of Government inaction has meant they need a scapegoat. And the scapegoat in this instance is not only your big money footballers and celebrities but your average Joe contractor. A contractor working for 5 years on a salary of £30,000 could be liable for a sum of around £40,000.

It would be unsurprising if Freelancers as a result are pushed into family breakdown, depression and sadly even suicide. Monies that have been saved for years will be wiped out overnight.

attributes.action: Make breaching Child Arrangement Orders a criminal offence enforceable by police
attributes.background: Breaching a Child Arrangement Order is a crime but currently the police are powerless. If an order is breached then the only option is to accept it or return to the courts to request enforcement action is taken against the other party. The process takes months, is expensive and emotionally draining.
attributes.additional_details:
Giving police power to enforce this crime would reduce the amount of people making a mockery out of the system. It would allow what the court has already decided as right and safe for the child, to continue without dispute.

There needs to be an instant deterrent, such as the issuing of an on the spot fine, with the amount increased after further breaches. Alternatively community service.

Why should the child suffer any longer then they have to when an informed decision has been made?

attributes.action: The UK must NOT adopt any new EU legislation during the "transition period".
attributes.background: On June 23rd 2016 the UK voted to Leave the European Union. We voted to take back control of our laws. If we are to have a "transition period" it would be completely unacceptable for the UK to accept any new EU rules and regulations during this transition period.
attributes.additional_details: Brexit means taking back control of our money, our borders, our trade deals and our laws. We voted for significant change and we expect to see change.

attributes.action: Introduce the Housing First policy into the UK so everyone has a home.
attributes.background: The Housing First program is a system that has been proven to work. Rather than homeless people going through multiple stages of housing, they are given around 3 months of accommodation,  by which point they can get a job and begin a new life. It is proven to cut down costs and is morally right.
attributes.additional_details: In the basic human rights,  everyone has the right to life and right to a home. Thousands do not have this in the UK. It is the governments job, that they must provide this for all citizens. This is not currently happening. By the introduction of the Housing First program, it means whomever falls upon hard times, has a back up and it will stop the unnecessary suffering of those currently on the street. It is the right thing to do. We can stop this crisis.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to wrongly describe food as gluten free
attributes.background: I have coeliac disease which means if I have gluten I can be violently ill. I have been given gluten more than 3 times in 3 separate restaurants and cafes. On one occasion a paramedic was called as mine and my friends spaghetti's were mixed up by the waitress. I was violently ill for over 2 hours.
attributes.additional_details:
Gluten free has become quite faddy and coeliac disease has fallen under the shadow of that.
There is a huge lack of education and sometimes full questioning and reassurance is needed in a restaurant before ordering and even then mistakes happen.
being glutened causes damage for about a week. Coeliac is an autoimmune disease not an intolerance.

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis oil for medicinal usage.
attributes.background:
Cannabis Oil is one of the oldest medicines known to Man. There has been numerous studies completed proving that cannabis oil can assist treating epilepsy, insomnia and even treat people suffering from cancer. 

Cannabidiol (CBD) can be developed for use with low THC content therefor no high...
attributes.additional_details:
Scientists are rapidly discovering more and more about the rather amazing abilities of the cannabinoids found in the cannabis plant. Most of them have shown therapeutic value, as have the terpenes, which give the plant its distinct odors. There are over 125 terpenes and over 80 cannabinoids in cannabis and each strain has its own unique blend that create its distinct effects. 
CBD also has the effect of reducing the undesirable effects of high-THC cannabis, such as anxiety and paranoia.

attributes.action: To authorise an amended version of the 1962 proposed Altrincham and Sale bypass.
attributes.background:
The A56 carries approx. 35,000 vehicles per day with HGVs and OGVs
contributing approx. 13.5% of this figure. Resulting air pollution affects peoples health, contributing to respiratory illness, heart disease and some cancers. Noise, road accidents, traffic congestion are other associated factors
attributes.additional_details:
Starting from the M60 Carrington Spur junction with Carrington Lane, going South across Carrington Moss towards Ashton Road joining the A56 west of the new A556 bypass, giving a direct link between the M60 jnc 8 to the M56 jnc 8 and onto the M6 jnc 19 via the new A556 intersections
Linking the M60 to the A56 west will create a new circular transportation network.
STOP THIS A56 TRAFFIC NIGHTMARE -BUILD THE ALTRINCHAM AND SALE BYPASS NOW.
Please sign the petition
Please sign this petition now.

attributes.action: PIP assessment for Mental health carried out by a doctor or mental health nurse
attributes.background:
PIP assessments for mental health should be carried out by mental health professionals.
I have been diagnosed with manic depression and been unable to claim PIP even though I meet all of the criteria, I'm now having to appeal which will eventually end up in a tribunal which will cost £100's and I'm
attributes.additional_details: not alone, so many of us that suffer from manic depression get rejected on PIP even though we all struggle, we then have more stress incurred through rejected appeals and hundreds of pounds from the government waisted for it to be over turned by the judge, if we just followed correct procedure and carried out the assessment properly with qualified memeber's of staff we would not only save money but also stress and potentially triggering worse episodes.

attributes.action: GPs & other professionals to be given  training on pulmonary fibrosis
attributes.background: My wife has just been diagnosed with this horrible illness. Going online, I found that a lot of people suffering are begging for help, saying that their GPs cannot help them and relying on people with this illness for help on reading most of their problems.
attributes.additional_details: Even some comforting advice would go a long way from them struggling for it. As a group on facebook they are trying to console and help each other. But it's expert advice they are begging for but are being fobbed off by most of their GPs. This is very important as my wife until Christmas was my carer but now we are both relying on our two daughters having to work part time for us. My wife was a council carer working till she retired so she has had no proper retirement, both of us are 72 this year.

attributes.action: Enact a Gaelic Languages Act; equal status for Irish, Scottish Gaelic & Welsh
attributes.background: The Welsh Language Act 1993 recognises that language on a UK-wide basis and status not enjoyed by Irish or Scottish Gaelic. The UK Government agreed to an Irish Act as part of the St Andrew's Agreement 2006. A UK 'Gaelic Languages Act' would be non-sectarian and give Gaelic the same status as Welsh.
attributes.additional_details:
In the UK you can establish a company, pay your taxes and renew your MOT in Welsh. The same should be true of Gaelic.


Welsh Language Act 1993:

https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1993/38/contents

St Andrew's Agreement 2006:

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/136651/st_andrews_agreement-2.pdf

Background in English: https://goo.gl/WpYhuW

Faisnéis chúlra i nGaeilge: https://goo.gl/MvU4YP

Cùl-fhiosrachadh ann an Gàidhlig: https://goo.gl/TSkBfd

attributes.action: Reduce the school days to just four days a week.
attributes.background: It is good for students to take a break, so they have a positive attitude to learning because they would not be overworked. Students would really appreciate this as they could spend more time with their family and friends.

attributes.action: Provide funding for specialist services for children with severe obesity
attributes.background: Childhood obesity can be the result and cause of other mental and physical health issues, such as type 2 diabetes, fatty liver and poor mobility. Specialist services and adequate funding for children with severe or morbid obesity (Tier 3) are urgently needed.
attributes.additional_details: A third of children in the UK are overweight or obese; for those with severe or morbid obesity (Tier 3) their weight is physically and emotionally debilitating. Adult Tier 3 services are available and funded but only 7% of LA/CCG provide Tier 3 services for children. The Government needs to provide adequate funding for specialist obesity services for children with complex needs, provide clear guidance on commissioning services and invest in the treatment services needed.

attributes.action: Make it a fineable offence to cross tidal roads outside of safe crossing times.
attributes.background: Every year dozens of people ignore the safe crossing times at the Holy Island causeway and are rescued by the RNLI. This not only risks lives and uses a service that could be required elsewhere, but also costs the taxpayer tens of thousands of pounds each year which could be avoided.
attributes.additional_details:
Figures from the Ministry of Defence in 2017 show a sea rescue costs approximately £1,900, while an air rescue by the RAF costs more than £4,000.

This petition relates to all tidal roads and causeways in the UK.

We, the undersigned, would like to see drivers who ignore safe crossing times on tidal roads/causeways and require rescue be fined for their actions, and for this money to be invested in the RNLI.

attributes.action: End the animal cruelty laws exemptions given to UK halal and shechita abattoirs
attributes.background: The EU’s 2009 slaughter regulation requires all animals, including poultry, be stunned before slaughter. Religious abattoirs in the UK are de facto exempt from the stun laws which apply to non-religious abattoirs. Animal welfare must take priority over faith tradition.
attributes.additional_details: Non-stun slaughter is cruel. Many consumers do not want to eat meat killed by religious slaughter. Meat killed by religious slaughter is not prepared in Parliament, so MPs know that they are not eating it, unless they specifically request it. On leaving the EU, specific UK legislation must replace the EU slaughter directive, explicitly precluding the religious exemption from pre-stunning requirement. Stun to kill must be mandatory.

attributes.action: Stop the pothole pandemic ravaging communities through out the UK.
attributes.background: A call to increase allocation of funds to councils by the government for road care. Following the heavy snow through out the UK and lack of funds councils are already granted to care for the roads, many new potholes have emerged, old ones re-opened and previously ones left to fester and grow.

attributes.action: Ensure all button batteries (lithium) sold in UK have a quantum coat
attributes.background: My daughter Freya swallowed a button battery when she was 11 months, which stuck in her oesophagus for 4 weeks, before it was removed, causing a chemical burn. Had it gone into her stomach, it might have killed her. If a button battery has a quantum coat, it makes it safe & inert when swallowed.
attributes.additional_details:
A 'quantum coat' means it only conducts electricity when squeezed, stopping the highly toxic effect of the battery when swallowed, which causes children thousands of horrific injuries and fatalities every year.
 It is likely to cost mere pennies per battery. Please see these references to prove the accuracy of our petition.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-29885832

https://www.greenoptimistic.com/batteries-made-child-safe-new-quantum-coating-20141105/#.WmS61UvLhTY

attributes.action: Launch an independent inquiry into the 5g Health & Safety risks
attributes.background: There seems to be much proof of the dangers of Mobile Phone masts as it is, and now 5g is to be rolled out with a far greater percentage of phone masts on every street in order to facilitate it. This is, given the evidence so far, a grave risk to each and every person in the UK
attributes.additional_details:
Dr Devra Davis
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BwyDCHf5iCY
Brain Tumours Links to Mobile Phone Use
https://academic.oup.com/ije/article/39/3/675/631387
Italian Court Rules Mobile Phones Cause Cancer
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2017/apr/21/italian-court-rules-mobile-phone-use-caused-brain-tumour

attributes.action: Bring in and legalise hand signals for riders to ask drivers to slow and stop
attributes.background: Horse riders are confronted with drivers driving too close and too fast causing many accidents to horses and riders, even death, with no convictions. Drivers need to be accountable for their actions, we need to be able to legally ask drivers to slow and stop to keep us safe.
attributes.additional_details: Horses are being left dead on the roads because drivers do not allow down or pass wide, resulting in injured or dead horses with rider injury, no driver can be prosecuted for hitting a horse the only way is for the rider to be admitted to hospital, this is wrong. We see over the hedges, we know if our horse might spook so sometimes we need drivers to stop and give us a few seconds. At the moment legally drivers do not have to abide our signals, we are on a living, sometimes unpredictable, animal.

attributes.action: A Public Inquiry into Carillion plc & the awarding of HS2 contracts
attributes.background: We the British Taxpayers want the Government to urgently launch a public inquiry into the awarding of all HS2 (High Speed Two Limited) contracts to Carillion plc despite grave concerns over their finances at the time the contracts were awarded.
attributes.additional_details: Despite profit warnings the Government awarded Carillion plc contracts on HS2 (High Speed 2) for £1.4 BILLION of public money. Following compulsory liquidation today 15 January 2018 we require an urgent public inquiry into how this was allowed to happen placing the country's economy in danger, putting thousands of jobs at risk and damaging confidence in UK construction markets. It is vital any potential criminal activity is investigated and acted on. Accountability is required by the taxpayer.

attributes.action: Commit to a long-term funding plan for health & social care to the year 2035.
attributes.background: We are calling on the government to recognise the rising demand, underfunding and workforce crisis in the NHS and social care sector by committing to a long-term funding plan for health and social care to the year 2035.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is supported by the NHS Confederation.

attributes.action: Ban the making and receiving of all phone calls whilst driving.
attributes.background: Cars kill. Research clearly shows a person is distracted from driving and their reaction times are slowed if on the phone, even if they are using it hands-free. No phone call is worth a distraction that could cause death. Help save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
The government has responded to the research intoducing harsher fines and penalties. A driver involved in an accident, if engaged in a phone call, will be prosecuted for driving without due care and attention as this will be considered to have contributed. In the case of a death they can be prosecuted for manslaughter and receive a prison sentence.

Research links:
 http://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/15389580600651103
http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1369847816000085

attributes.action: Rebury remains of WW2 Royal Navy sailors dug up by metal scavengers in Indonesia
attributes.background: This petition calls on the Government to rebury the remains of British Royal Navy WW2 sailors, who died on HMS Exeter and HMS Electra, that were dug up and dumped in an anonymous mass grave in Indonesia by metal scavengers. We want these remains recovered and buried with the dignity they deserve.
attributes.additional_details:
Reports in the Guardian, the Dutch and Indonesian media state since 2014 up to 40 WW2 vessels in the Java sea have been partially or completely destroyed by metal scavengers. This includes the disturbing and dumping of remains of WW2 Royal Navy sailors, who died on British warships, HMS Exeter, HMS Electra and HMS Encounter in an anonymous mass grave. 

The Guardian article is here

https://www.theguardian.com/world/2018/jan/22/bodies-of-second-world-war-sailors-in-java-sea-dumped-in-mass-grave

attributes.action: Keep the iconic burgundy British passport
attributes.background: The government has stated its intention to change UK passports from red to blue. This needless colour change would bring no benefits. Since no under-40 ever possessed a blue passport, a change would mean little except to a shrinking minority. To young people, the red passport is the iconic one.
attributes.additional_details:
Changing the colour would be a backwards step for a country that seeks, in the words of the Prime Minister, to be a forward-looking nation with a 'dynamic, creative spirit'.

It is also unclear why, since we are exiting the EU, we would want to change passports from the current patriotic red to the colours of the EU flag. Since EU member states are allowed any colour of passport they like, changing would be no great statement of sovereignty, as some have suggested.

While frivolous petitions are quite rightfully rejected, passport colour is of serious concern to many around the country. As the Immigration Minister says: “One of the most iconic things about being British is having a British passport.” I trust, therefore, that this petition will be treated with the seriousness it merits.

attributes.action: Provide a linked network of traffic-free horse riding & carriage driving routes.
attributes.background: Riders & horses die every month! Over 1.3 million regular horse riders, with over 3 million occasional riders. The equine industry has 19 million consumers & is worth over £4.3 billion pa. 600,000 more than cars, the only way to prevent injuries and deaths of riders & horses is safe off road access.
attributes.additional_details:
National Equestrian survey 2015
Dept of transport
British Horse Industry Confederation

attributes.action: Ask UN to take Jerusalem under its protection.
attributes.background: US recognition of Jerusalem as Israel's capital has emboldened Israel to carry on denying that East Jerusalem is occupied. The only fair solution is to return to the 1947 Partition Plan and make Jerusalem a corpus separatum.

attributes.action: Create Constituents' Charter & Independent Ombudsman re: Complaints About MPs
attributes.background: At the moment, there is no definition of an MP's legal duties and obligations to their constituents. Of course, most do their jobs very well, but some do not. And at the moment, there is virtually nothing anyone can do about such 'rogue' MP's. That is why we want Parliament to:
attributes.additional_details:
1. Create a Constituents' Charter which will;
2. Define the legal obligations an MP has toward their constituents
3. Provide a clear legal definition of a 'legitimate' query
4. Require MPs to answer all 'legitimate' constituent queries
5. Define strict time limits for MP replies
6. Include an Independent Ombudsman for Complaints Against MPs

attributes.action: Make NHS England declare by law the value of contracts awarded to private bodies
attributes.background: Last year private companies won nearly 70% of all NHS contracts. Making public declaration of all assets sold (and scope of contracts won) a legal requirement would allow the public to see a true picture of the extent of NHS privatisation. The public deserves better visibility, and to be consulted.
attributes.additional_details:
All services run by non NHS bodies and all assets sold should be declared publicly, and made visible to the public where they operate and on their communications. 

Private care providers were awarded 267 out of a total of 386 contracts made available in 2016-17, including the seven highest value opportunities, worth £2.4bn. 
Source: 'Time to end the NHS experiment with the market', NHS Support Federation, Dec 2017.

attributes.action: End the 'hostile environment' for immigration & revoke the 2014 immigration act
attributes.background: The 2014 bill the bill makes it as inconvenient and unpleasant as possible to live in Britain without documents by privatising the process of checking status to people in civil society.
attributes.additional_details: This has directly led to the Windrush debacle and quite rightly lots of opprobrium and calls for 'amnesty' for Windrush generation. However the immigration act 2014 is causing issues for all people who have immigrated here and should be revoked.

attributes.action: Make cervical scans compulsory for anyone that has received cervical treatment
attributes.background: In Feb 2012 I underwent a LLETZ procedure to remove CIN 2 pre-cancerous cells from my cervix. When I fell pregnant in October 2014 I had an appointment with a medical registrar who advised there would be no effect on my pregnancy. In March 2015 my waters broke at 24 weeks & my son passed away.
attributes.additional_details:
At the time nobody was aware of what had caused my waters to break as I had received no monitoring during my pregnancy. Had I received cervical scans like I did in my subsequent pregnancy they would have been able to diagnose me with Incompetent Cervix & put a stitch in to save my son. 

Due to the amount of cells that were removed I was deemed to be 'low risk'. So if a low risk patient can lose a child then anybody can and this is totally unnecessary heartbreak that could have been prevented.

attributes.action: Launch the Sharia-compliant student finance for University fee funding.
attributes.background: Many Muslims are unable to go to university as their faith prohibits interest based finance. In 2014, the government undertook to introduce an alternative loan by 2016 but have not yet done so. With enough support, the Sharia-compliant finance can finally be launched to fund university tuition fees.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite promises in introducing the alternative finance by 2016, we now approach the 2018 academic year with yet no action. We feel these delays demonstrate a lack of urgency in addressing the plight of those students currently unable to benefit from university education. With enough support, this can be prioritised and we hope that
the Shari’a-compliant finance for funding university fees can be introduced by September 2018.
The alternative fee funding structure can be found here,
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/303423/bis-13-1311-consultation-on-a-sharia-compliant-alternative-finance-product.pdf

Further information: http://www.halalstudentloans.co.uk/

attributes.action: Stop UK coastal crude oil pollution threat; ban Colter offshore oil rig.
attributes.background: The oil rig four miles off Bournemouth beach must be stopped and the Government should commit to a permanent ban on all offshore drilling in the area. Bournemouth, Poole and the wider coastal area is reliant on tourism and the natural beauty of the coast.
attributes.additional_details: A blowout could result in 20,000,000 gallons of leaked oil over thousands of square miles, devastating UK coasts, and their economies. Drilling offshore Bournemouth is a reckless gamble with our precious coastlines. It does not meet ALARP (as low as reasonably practicable) principles because there is an alternative - a nearby land-based extended reach drilling facility, where an oil spill could be contained and considerably reduced compared to a subsea leak directly into the sea.

attributes.action: Review the exclusion of alternative milks to dairy using Healthy Start Vouchers
attributes.background: Approx 2 million people live in the UK with a food allergy (National Institute for Health and Clinical Excellence, 2011). Cows milk costs 43p/L. Oat milk costs £1.79/L The cost of alternative milks on low income families is detrimental. Alternative formula costs more than £30 per tin.
attributes.additional_details:
Alternative milk eg: oat milk contains 36% RDA for calcium; 1 serving of whole milk contains 28%. An allergy can be considered a disability. It is discrimatory to exclude low income families from their non-dairy nutritional needs: the Equality Act (2010) is not being upheld. If it is sufficient to expect the sole purpose of non-dairy users to use them on fruit & veg, then why include cows milk or formula at all?
https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=396559724104198&id=296629500763888

attributes.action: Abolish driver cpc, it's not improving driver standards, it's causing a shortage
attributes.background: The Driver cpc was brought in to educate and raise standards of professional drivers, this has had no affect, as a driver I see the standards are the same. Drivers learn their skill set in accordance to their jobs. Forcing drivers to pay thousands in useless training, causing a huge driver shortage

attributes.action: Get the transport secretary to review the C2C rail contract.
attributes.background: Since Trentalia took over the C2C contract the service has become so bad it is directly affecting customers lives. Frequent train malfunctions, delays and staff on the social media channels lying to the customers about being able to claim delay repay are rendering the service unusable.
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the things C2C customers have suffered from of late include:

- Being ejected at stations like Barking or Upminster with no explanation.
- Being lied to that delay repay covers your total journey when the online system ONLY takes into account train time.
- Broken trains on a regular basis.
- Cancelled trains on a regular basis.
- Shortened trains every day since last summer.
- Delays on a weekly basis that do not 'qualify' for a refund.

attributes.action: Increase Policing in Coventry
attributes.background: We are concerned about high levels of crime and lack of policing in the area. Therefore we call on the Home Secretary to give more resources to the West Midlands Police Force and Coventry in particular.

attributes.action: Decriminalise, legalise and regulate cannabis for medicinal and recreational use
attributes.background:
The use of illegal drugs, impacts on the social and economic well being of the country, including its reputation overseas. 

The Government’s organised crime strategy sets out that drug trafficking to the UK costs an estimated £10.7 billion per year. (National Crime Agency, 2018).
attributes.additional_details:
Cannabis is still the most widely used illegal drug in the UK and the UK wholesale cannabis market is worth almost £1 billion a year. The NCA estimates that 270 tonnes of cannabis is needed to satisfy annual UK user demand. (National Crime Agency, 2018).

www.nationalcrimeagency.gov.uk

The number of arrests and court cases associated with cannabis-related offences have declined substantially in the states that have legalized cannabis. (World Drug Report, 2016). 

www.unodc.org/wdr2016/

attributes.action: Allow student nurses to receive the 30 hours funding for childcare
attributes.background: Student nurses don't get enough money to cover childcare costs. The 30 hours funding is only available to people who earn 120pw but it is not fair that student nurses have to work 37.5 hours at placement then work 2 days to meet this criteria

attributes.action: Create a Minister for Men that operates separately from the Minister for Women
attributes.background:
A 'Minister for Women (and Equalities)' cannot simultaneously be a 'Minister for Men' yet, that is what's in place.
Despite men raising issues in Parliament, men's issues are not raised.
A male-specific voice is required, equality demands it!
attributes.additional_details:
Such issues for the Minister for Men to address:
Paternity Rights (or, the lack of!)
Male Suicide (4x higher than female)
Homelessness (approx. 90% male)
Education (boys have been failing at every level since the 1990s)
Domestic Violence (40% victims are male)
False Allegations of Abuse
Disparity in health funding (prostate v breast cancer)
More information: https://ministerformen.wordpress.com

attributes.action: Enforce Vets to report Alabama Rot cases/location-fine the Vets if not.
attributes.background: Dylan died with Alabama Rot & we have heard of other unconfirmed cases in other local areas. We were told Dylan's case didn't need to be reported as he had a trace of New Forest Syndrome (the same as Alabama Rot) & he died of Vasculitus (Alabama Rot caused the Kidney Failure).
attributes.additional_details:
Alabama rot (CRGV) is a fatal condition in in 9 out of 10 dogs. The initial symptoms are skin lesions on the legs, chest and abdomen followed by renal involvement.
This information can be found on the Alabama Rot website and on your browser as this will bring up numerous cases which have been found throughout the country.  
Dylan's lesions started on his abdomen, he stopped eating (which was very unlike him as he loved his food) and was sleeping all of the time. 
How many cases have gone unreported?  
How many areas are infected that we are unaware of? Vets are only morally obliged to report cases.
Can this be called Dylan's Law if passed?

attributes.action: For All prisons in the Uk to become 'Autism friendly'
attributes.background: There is very little training in prisons for officers/ staff to recognise and support Autistic adults  entering the prison and  serving  their sentence. Only one prison in the UK called Feltham, has been Autism accredited and has made such a huge impact on supporting Autistic prisoners .

attributes.action: include The Baha'i Faith as part of the Religious Studies Syllabus in Schools.
attributes.background:
The Baha'i Faith is the world's youngest religion. It is only 173 years old.

It brings all other major religions together and is based on Unity of Mankind.

It makes sense! and can potentially save a lot of conflicts in the world.

www.bahai.org

attributes.action: Stop Network Rail's programme to fell millions of trees
attributes.background: Network Rail recently began cutting down trees on a massive scale. We call on the government to halt this tree felling programme until a comprehensive public consultation has been conducted, to include relevant wildlife and environmental bodies such as The Wildlife Trust, RSPB, The Tree Council, etc

attributes.action: Give all UK residents the right to vote in local government elections
attributes.background: There should be a change in electoral law to ensure that everyone who is permanently resident in the UK and of voting age has the right to vote in local government elections.
attributes.additional_details: For those who live in a local community, numerous aspects of their daily life – such as housing, education, local amenities, public transport, cultural and sports facilities – are influenced by decisions taken by the local authority. It is therefore only fair to extend the right to vote and be elected in local elections to all long-term UK residents, regardless of their citizenship. Such a move would also ensure that EU citizens retain their right to vote in local elections after Brexit.
